meanings.definition: To cut or tear into small pieces
meanings.sent1: She shredded the paper into tiny bits for the art project.
meanings.sent2: The chef shredded the carrots to add to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The cat shredded the curtains while playing around.
meanings.sent4: The tornado shredded everything in its path, leaving only debris.
meanings.sent5: The shredder hummed as it efficiently shredded the documents.

meanings.definition: Torn or ripped into thin strips
meanings.sent1: The shredded paper was used for packing fragile items.
meanings.sent2: He wore a shredded denim jacket to the concert.
meanings.sent3: The shredded lettuce added a nice crunch to the sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The old flag was shredded by the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The shredded cheese melted perfectly on the pizza.

meanings.definition: To destroy or damage something severely
meanings.sent1: The company's reputation was shredded after the scandal.
meanings.sent2: The storm shredded the roof of the house.
meanings.sent3: His argument shredded her confidence in her work.
meanings.sent4: The loud music shredded her concentration while studying.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism shredded his self-esteem.
